STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 4, 2024
Chad Ulferts
Wayne County DHHS- Western
27540 Michigan Ave.
INKSTER, MI, 48141-2202
Re: License #: CP820201497
Dear Mr. Ulferts:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
10/10/2024. An Exit conferenc was held with the agency on 10/18/2024. Due to the
violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer on 517-899-6024.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Lonia Perry Calloway, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
2

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

children in foster home, Supervise

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12209 Orientation and training.
(1) An agency shall ensure and document all the
following:
(a) That each social service worker and each social
service supervisor receives not less than 16 hours of
orientation after initial appointment and before
assumption of assigned duties.
One of 18 employee records reviewed, where the employee was promoted to a
supervisor, did not show documentation of 16 hours of orientation, as required by
the rule.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records.
(3) The personnel record must contain both of the
following:
(a) A written evaluation of a staff member's performance
within a probationary period or not later than 6 months
after the staff member assumes his or her current
responsibilities. After the initial evaluation, a written
evaluation must be conducted every 12 months.
Seven of 18 employee records reviewed did not show compliance:
2

• Four records where probationary evaluations were due by 6/1/2024,
6/1/2024, 8/10/2024 and 9/7/2024 were completed late on 7/13/2024;
9/25/2024; 10/2/2024 and 9/17/2024 respectively.
• A fifth record where a six-month performance evaluation was due by
3/1/2024, for the employee's promotion to supervisor, was completed late on
4/1/2024.
• A sixth and seventh employee record showed the respective employee’s
2024 annual evaluation was completed late on 8/28/2024 and 9/17/2024, with
respect to each employee’s last evaluation on 8/8/2023.
Repeat Violation Established:
Renewal 2022, CAP approved 11/9/2022.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy must,
include all the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows,
unless a greater frequency is medically indicated:
(i) A comprehensive medical examination, including a
behavioral/mental health and trauma screening, within
30 calendar days from the date the child entered into an
out-of-home placement, regardless of the date of the last
physical examination.
One of eight open foster child records reviewed showed the child's initial medical
due by 11/25/2023 was completed late on 2/23/2024.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy must,
include all the following:
(e) A dental re-examination must be completed within 3
months before entry in foster care or an initial dental
examination must be completed not more than 90
calendar days after entry into a foster care out- of-home
placement. A child under 1 year of age must have an
initial dental exam within 3 month of his or her first
birthday.
3

One of eight open foster child records reviewed showed the child was placed in a
foster care placement on 4/15/2024 and a dental was due by 7/14/2024. The dental
was completed 10 days late on 7/24/2024.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy must,
include all the following:
(f) A dental re-examination must be obtained at least
every 9 months, unless a greater frequency is indicated.
One of eight open foster child records reviewed showed a dental was due by
12/21/2023 and completed late on 5/16/2024.
CPA Rule 400.12419 Initial service plans.
(1) The initial service plan, as required in R
400.12418(2)(a), must include all the following
information:
(c) Assessment of the placement selection criteria as
required under R400.12404(4).
Two of eight open foster child records reviewed did not show documentation of (c)
related to the child’s initial service plan. The information was left blank.
Repeat Violation Established:
Renewal 2022, CAP approved 11/9/2022.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
R400.12419(1)(h)-Initial service plans & R400.12420(1)(g)-Updated service
plans.
The agency was provided technical assistance related to how to document
behavioral support plans for very younger children and those with severe
physical/medical special needs.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R400.12418(5) Development of service plans:
4

The agency was advised ensuring that all parties check the appropriate boxes at
the end of the treatment plan, that indicates the service plan being reviewed with
them, their participation in the development of the service plan, and that they
received a copy, may aid the agency in demonstrating compliance to the rule.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. This
corrective action plan related to the agency’s 2023 Renewal inspection. The
agency received nine citations in 2023; and six this year. Of the six rule violations
received this year, none are repeat rule violation. The agency implemented its
corrective action plan and made progress with it as demonstrated by this
inspection.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator submitted a report dated 10/4/2024. The chief
administrator reported Western Wayne continues to be negatively impacted by
turnovers in both the worker and supervisor roles, as well as staff leaves of
absences, promotions, job changes, and resignations. That modifications related
to caseload size, needing to transfer cases to purchase of service staff to allow
direct care worker greater focus, impacted compliance to child placing agencies
rules.
Notwithstanding the challenges the agency indicated facing, they reported
continuing all efforts to maintain and or gain compliance. They reported they
continue to utilize a helpful foster care checklist they updated in November 2023
and each foster care unit participates in regular upload days to upload required
documents into MiSACWIS. Additionally, that another area of focus has been
compliance with Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). That individual unit meetings
are held monthly to review compliances and barriers.
Financial Overview
This is a Department of Health and Human Services agency. No financial
documentation is required.
Staff Interviews
In addition to discussion with the chief administrator, a section manager, and the
administrative assistant four foster care specialists and one supervisor were
interviewed. The staff interviewed acknowledged some efforts by the agency’s
5

morale committee, an appreciation for the Director’s efforts to interface in different
meetings, and his attendance at times translating to support for staff and support
from individual team members. Areas of growth/needs reported on were for
reduced caseloads, more practical support from supervisors, a training
team/person similar to what CPS has for new staff as well as some kind of manual
to assist staff in learning/knowing how to accomplish the various tasks that are a
part of their job.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the agency’s office did not reveal any areas of concern. There
was sufficient space and equipment for staff and files were secure. The agency
has gone paperless, and files/documents are electronically stored.
VII. CHILD PLACING AGENCY ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety alerts this reporting period.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
October 30, 2024
________________________________________
Lonia Perry Calloway Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 4, 2024
